title: Identify
text: Identify what you are solving for.

title: What Are You Solving For
text: You are solving for the parents' driving speed.

title: Make a Variable
text: Create a variable to represent the speed of Christopher's parents. Let's call the this speed $$x$$. Since Christopher's average speed is $$10$$ mph faster than his parents' average speed, Christopher's average speed is $$x+10$$.

title: Translate to Equation
text: Translate the situation into an equation using the variable. Remember the distance Christopher travelled plus the distance his parents travel must add up to $$115$$ miles, and distance equals the product of speed and time.

title: Solving the Equation
text: After solving the equation, what do you get for $$x$$?

subHints.title: Solving the Equation
subHints.text: To solve the equation $$\operatorname{1.5}\left(x+10\right)+1x=115$$, we follow these steps: 4x=5x-60-->60=5x-4x-->x=60.
